intro: Scolymocephalus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceolate scolymus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it is adapted to thrive in dry conditions with minimal water requirements. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
